notes.text:
Low and slow is the secret
Can also use a slow cooker
Leftovers freeze beautifully

steps.descr: Mix paprika, brown sugar, garlic powder, salt, pepper for rub

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started by mixing our spices. You'll want a lovely, even mix of paprika, brown sugar, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Give it a good stir!

steps.instructions: Mix paprika, brown sugar, garlic powder, salt, pepper for rub

steps.descr: Rub spice mix all over pork shoulder

on_enter.say: Now, let's get that beautiful spice rub all over your pork shoulder. Make sure it's completely covered for maximum flavour!

steps.instructions: Rub spice mix all over pork shoulder

steps.descr: Slow cook at 120°C for 5-6 hours until tender

on_enter.say: Fantastic! Now, pop that pork into your oven at 120°C. We're going to let it cook low and slow for 5 to 6 hours. Your kitchen will smell amazing!

steps.instructions: Slow cook at 120°C for 5-6 hours until tender

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Now that the pork is tender, grab two forks and start shredding it. It should fall apart easily.
Let's add some of that lovely BBQ sauce to our shredded pork. Mix it well so every bit is coated in that delicious sauce.
Time to pile that beautiful pork onto your toasted buns. Make sure you get a good amount on each one!
Finally, let's top it off with some crunchy coleslaw. And there you have it, a perfect pulled pork sandwich ready to enjoy!

recipe.title: Pulled Pork Sandwich
recipe.description: Slow-cooked tender pork with BBQ sauce on a soft bun
